001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.protocol.http;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.FlowAssembler;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.MetricsPort;
005import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.ByteStream;
006import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.TcpSegment;
007import java.util.Optional;
008
009/**
010 * Basic HTTP flow assembler that forwards non-empty TCP payloads as ByteStream slices, preserving
011 * direction and timestamps. Future iterations can enhance this to perform true reassembly.
012 */
013public final class HttpFlowAssemblerAdapter implements FlowAssembler {
014  private final MetricsPort metrics;
015
016  /**
017   * Creates an HTTP flow assembler adapter.
018   *
019   * @param metrics metrics sink for assembler statistics
020   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code metrics} is {@code null}
021   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
022   */
023  public HttpFlowAssemblerAdapter(MetricsPort metrics) {
024    this.metrics = metrics;
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Emits a {@link ByteStream} for each non-empty HTTP payload while recording metrics.
029   *
030   * @param segment HTTP segment to evaluate; may be {@code null}
031   * @return stream slice when payload is non-empty; otherwise empty
032   * @implNote Emits one {@link ByteStream} per segment; higher-layer reassembly occurs elsewhere.
033   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
034   */
035  @Override
036  public Optional<ByteStream> accept(TcpSegment segment) {
037    if (segment == null) {
038      metrics.increment("http.flowAssembler.nullSegment");
039      return Optional.empty();
040    }
041
042    byte[] payload = segment.payload();
043    if (payload.length == 0) {
044      metrics.increment("http.flowAssembler.emptyPayload");
045      return Optional.empty();
046    }
047
048    metrics.increment("http.flowAssembler.payload");
049    metrics.observe("http.flowAssembler.bytes", payload.length);
050    ByteStream slice =
051        new ByteStream(
052            segment.flow(),
053            segment.fromClient(),
054            payload,
055            segment.timestampMicros());
056    return Optional.of(slice);
057  }
058}
059
